author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Election Commission of India (ECI) has disqualified a person who failed to produce the expenses incurred during last parliamentary election.

ECI communicated its order to Chief Electoral Officer V. Candavelou recently.

In the order, the ECI held that Marie Uthrianathan, an independent candidate, had failed to lodge the account of his election expenses incurred during last parliamentary election as required by the Representation of the People Act, 1951.
title: ECI disqualifies independent
